name: Josh Watford
text: Judson College has remained true to its mission for nearly 200 years: Christian education for women. Rigorous academics plus service-based learning make well rounded women ready for the workforce and to make a difference for the kingdom of God in their community. Dr. Tew is leading the college well, and I’m very thankful for his leadership.

name: Claudia L Murphy
text: The faculty, staff, & students are so friendly. It's a very welcoming, hospitable place. The majority of the young women are very talented, creative, eager to excel, & just delightful to be around. Among them are beautiful, sweet faces whose goodness radiates from sweet souls.  .  .  .a little bit of heaven on Earth.

resp.text: Thanks so much for your sweet words, Claudia. We strive daily to be a "home" for our students, because we feel that when their basic needs are met (especially feeling "at home"), they feel prepared/eager to show that same care and concern to others--thereby reflecting Light and Truth in the world. :)

name: Brittany Johnson
text: I've gone here for two years now. It has become my home away from home, and I hate having to be away for summers! The people are great, the buildings are being fixed up, and the food improves daily! Yes, it has it's flaws, and it isn't right for everyone, but Judson is the place where young women can go in and become life longer learners. We also don't usually meet our husbands here, but we do get to meet our bridesmaids :) Hope this helped out someone!

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words, Brittany! Glad you've found your home away from home here. :)

text: I went to the large animal clinic for my goat, and they were amazing. Doctor Copedge was very knowledgeable and the students were great too. Everyone was very caring and did all they could to help.

name: Elise Hancock
text: Our German Shepherd  Bella required surgery (cranial cruciate rupture) and the care she received from everyone she came in contact with was absolutely superb. In particular, Dr. Howard King, Clint Martin took great care of her as if she was there own.  We are so grateful to all she came in contact with at your superb facility." Thank you so much.

name: Batpuppies Tahtah
text: Tuskegee posted on their site today that they were being attacked by activist groups. In fact, a lot of people are up in arms because they use live animals that they acquire from the county pound. They say they only take animals that are scheduled for euthanasia. That is not a true statement either. All of the animals they have taken for LIVE experimentation and suffer terminal surgery. They claim they take very good care of the animals. In fact, every animal there whether small or large are fed the exact same amount of food once a day - 1 cup of food. They claim that this practice is done by every other vet university when, in fact, it is not. This practice is only done by three schools total in the US and Tuskegee is the lowest rated school. There are other ways to train future vets without inhumane extreme cruelty to animals. We would not do this to our children. Then why are they allowed to do this. All animals are part of someone’’s family. Those animals would have been taken to shelters, no kill shelters, etc, so that they can find homes and not be tortured to death. Wake up people. This should not be the kind of people we are. Ever.

name: Rochelle Matlock-Charlie
text: My pets have been  customers of the vet clinic for years now.  I love the treatment my dogs get as well as how professional the students and staff are. The clinic is always clean they also board animals. Go Skegee!

name: Sheila Sanders
text:
Tuskegee University Small Animal Hospital is the best. My Snoopy has been ill for over a year and after so many test, ultrasounds, x-rays and false diagnosis I was given a referral to have Snoppy be seen by Dr. Martin and her staff in April of this year. After our second drive from Atlanta Snoopy was finally diagnosed by her and her team. (After trying to get the same results for 11 months from his hospital in Atlanta he's been a patient of for 10 plus years. ) Dr. Mendoza was our first Doctor that helped take care of my baby when he had to stay a few nights to Catlin who on Ranks Supreme. Everyone that knows me knows how much I Love My Baby Snoopy and how I hate to leaving him in the hospital, but Catlin calms my soul. She called everyday for a week sometimes twice a day to give me an update on Snoopy. She  always made me feel at ease after every conversation. Snoopy was discharged over a week ago and she still called after his discharge almost everyday checking on my baby and offering me solutions. Unfortunately Snoopy is back but with the help form Catlin and Dr. Martin I think this time around the procedure they have suggested for Snoopy will get him on the road to Recovery. I've yet to meet Catlin but I hear that today September 13th is her birthday. Have a great one and I hope you will stop in to check on Snoopy. I hope the new person Morgan stepping in to fill your shoes will carry the same torch you did!

PS Morgan will as soon I submitted this post. A few minutes later Morgan called to give me an update on Snoopy now I can rest a little easier tonight.

name: M. Moore
text:
I wish I could post 4 stars, but I cannot. My experience was anything but pleasant. My Miniature Pinscher was misdiagnosed by Dr. Vigg which caused her a major relapse and a 1 week stay at Auburn University Small Animal Hospital.

My Min Pin has a neurological condition and was under the care of the Neuro Team from UGA. 3 weeks before she was seen by Dr. Vigg, she was on the lowest dose of Predinisolone and being weaned off. I had travel to work a project in Maryland and my Aunt was watching her. My fur baby was not eating and drinking and showed signs of neck pain. She was taken to TU Vet school and Dr. Vigg was made aware of her MUE condition.

1 week later, Mahogany could no longer walk and had to be rushed to the ER. The Neuro at Auburn University called me and inquired about her visit with Dr. Vigg and after talking with my Aunt about her med management, it was discovered he made my Aunt take her off the meds and this was why she had the severe relapse . He advised my Aunt to take her off the prescribed Prednisolone by her Neurologist, stating it was making her sick and to keep her crated for 90 days.

Mahogany's meds tripled and her re-checks which were every 3 months changed to monthly.

I could not get TU to call me back and had to almost harrass them before I was able to speak with Dr. Bellamy who refused to address any wrong doing and stated, "what do you want me to do about it! She's a dog!" Dr. Bellamy was unprofessional and I questioned why she wanted to be a Vet. If these animals are only "animals" to her and not a life worth protecting, why is she in the field to care for them?

Dr. Bellamy nor Dr. David McKenize have replied to emails, although they promised they would.

Please make sure you think throughly before taking your pet to this Hospital. I know mistakes happen, however; as a Medical entity, there is a duty to make sure you are licensed to practice in a specialty and Dr. Vigg was not. Dr. Bellamy told me he did not have to be but that is not true and the Neurologists at Auburn and UGA confirmed this. They said you NEVER pull a canine off a steroid suddenly as their system will go into shock and if he were a Neuro, he would know this.

A lot of progress was made to get Mahogany back on track and Dr. Vigg's negligence caused the Neuros to go back to the drawing board which upset them. They told me he never should have treated her for a Neuro condition as he is not a licensed Neurologist.

Please think twice before coming to Tuskegee University Vet Hospital. Auburn is far more rounded and the professionalism/bed-side manner exercised along with certified Medical Professionals who treat your pet with care is reasonating. It gives you peace of mind to know your pet will be given the utmost care. TU, on the other hand, views them as 4-legged property with no regard to the level of care amd treatment they are given.

name: Its Me
text: Dr. Parra is honestly the best large animal  Veterinarian hands down! Very thorough and attentive in all he does! Tuskegee University over Auburn any day!

name: Caitlin Berman
text: This school should be ashamed in letting a student graduate who pretended to be a rescue and sent 50 horses to slaughter. She was arrested twice. Unbelievable.

name: Alexis Adams
text: Friendly service

name: Meghan Jenkins
text: TERRIBLE! Dr. Bellamy is HORRIFIC and bringing that school DOWN TO THE GROUND.

name: Edwin Williams
text: Great staff and doctors!

name: Chris Miller
text: Great teachers for the most part, and the classes are good learning environments. Garbage campus. The campus has multiple parking lots the size of football fields that are chronically empty, but now you have to buy a parking pass to park on campus as a student. Tuition is expensive, but count on paying more due to things like this.  A good example of universities’ disregard of students in the interest of raking in an extra dollar. Great teachers though.

name: Kareem Martin
text: A great place to continue you education

name: Cindy Ferguson
text: Beautiful!

name: OWP W P
text:
Professor I have is great! Passionate about the subject and actually teaches, and takes questions and answer them really well. One of the better professor I have had.

Administration is good. I had some registration issues and they resolved it fairly quickly.

Students are a different issue.  Most of them really doesn't seem to care about learning. They just want to pass and get their degrees. They don't really engage in class discussion. My class was mostly educators; that makes me worry very much about our future.The class was mostly adults. WORST OF ALL, the class after me has very little etiquette. They would walk in while we are still in class (the period was over) and literally take my seat and push my stuff away while I am talking to the professor after class; happened multiple times and doesn't want to get out of the way while I try to gather my stuff. Note: evening class, mostly adult students.

I have an undergrad from another university. And this is the 3rd University I have taken classes at.

name: Ann English
text: I've loved my time at Troy, and I especially liked the Dothan campus.  Like another reviewer stated, there are plenty of adults that take classes there. Yes, some of the students are not the nicest, but that is an individual thing and not Troy University's fault. The faculty are so nice and really want to see the students succeed.

name: Marvin Davis
text: There is nothing on your website that tells me where Sony Hall is.

resp.text: It is located in R. Terry Everett Hall.

name: Todd Chancey
text: Great

name: S H
text: Have really loved my time at Amridge. To be fair, haven’t started paying back the student loans yet, so I might be mad at them later. I’m not gonna say they are perfect, but as someone who has went to 5 different colleges/universities I will say that Amridge has the best professors and instructors of any of them hands down.

name: Steve Brown
text:
Amridge University has been a nightmare to deal with. They lied right off the bat with stating that Biblical languages were not required for this specific degree. After signing up they never established a link with Canvas until the second day of the starting semester. upon watching the first part of the very first lecture, I realized that they had misrepresented themselves and asked to be removed from their roster. They have since sent a bill totaling just under $4,000. for a class that was never started. Ask yourself is this Christian activity, it appears like their god is mammon. The class did not actually start until the second of the month, I did not have access until the second day of the class. Save yourself a lot of hassle and look elsewhere for a true Christian experience and education.

Update, Amridge University did finally do what was right after I submitted a form for review and retract the fees for that semester, for which I am greatful.

resp.text: Steve, thank you for letting us know about the situation. We have reached out to you to resolve your issues and we hope the resolution that was provided was the solution that was needed

name: Deanna Brown
text: This school was a nightmare to deal with. Was advised did not need Hebrew to start off and right out of the gate they expected you to know Hebrew. Dropped my first class within the first hour, and now an being charged over $1300! They said there was a 10% fee, why am I being charged over a third for the class? When I called to ask, financial aid kept cutting me off to tell me the guidelines. I asked her to please listen to my question, she was rude and not willing to actually talk with me. I refuse to sit back and pay over $1300 for an hour being in the class! Erika just kept telling me to file an appeal, the rules are the rules.

resp.text: Deanna, thank you for letting us know about the situation. We have reached out to you to resolve your issues and we hope the resolution that was provided was the solution that was needed

It's been months since I needed to go to a.physical location (online bachelor's program) and today's experience was no different than any other. Great staff. Great school.

text: If you’re going here for HVACR don’t waste your money here! My night  instructor was lazy as hell and had us taking long long breaks, for hours! The only reason I’m giving two stars is because  The best instructor was Mr Smith he was the best morning instructor here wish I stayed in the morning classes too late now 😞

resp.text: We take such feedback seriously and would like the chance to speak with you about your concerns. Please call (205) 802-1200 and ask for President Southerland if you would like to discuss your experience.

name: John Doe
text: CDL class was 20 people to 3 instructors. The instructors are great but the student to instructor ratio is way too high. Very  little time in the truck with an instructor, maybe 1-1/2-2 hours a week behind the wheel with a instructor. Most of the time you are standing in the hot sun waiting for 19 other people to finish their turn so you can get a few minutes in the truck just driving in the parking lot. When I signed up they said class size was 8-10, with 4 instructors, but it turned out to be 20 students with 3 instructors. If the class had been 8-10 my review would be much better.

resp.text: We take such feedback seriously and would like the chance to speak with you about your concerns. Please call (205) 802-1200 and ask for President Southerland if you would like to discuss your experience.

name: Kandi Johnson
text: I have not yet started classes but I am going through the enrollment process  and I am extremely pleased with how friendly everyone has been. Everyone has been really helpful and welcoming. They are excited FOR ME which is very reassuring and has relieved a lot of stress considering this is such a giant step for myself and my family. I hope this continues throughout my matriculation with Virginia College!

name: Mary Woods
text: Respiratory Therapy program is great. Now, we have the same curriculum as Wallace State Comm. College and as of December 2012, 98% of the programs graduates have passed the CRT and are currently working in the Respiratory field. I am a 1st year respiratory student and have already been offered a student position in the field. I am very pleased with all of my instructors and the education I am receiving.

name: Nadia Champion
text: Absolutely terrible at trying to help you build yourself up. I just got off the phone with my representative trying to get positive feed back and figure what I should do instead of quit but they just talked me into quitting and having a horrible outlook on the school. Can't believe this coming from this school.

resp.text: We take feedback seriously and we would like the chance to discuss your concerns. Please call (205) 802-1200 and ask for President Turner if you would like to discuss your experience.

name: J Walk
text: I am saddened to read many of the comments here regarding student experiences.  I attended Virginia College @ Birmingham from 2009 and graduated in 2012 from the DMS program.  I can honestly without a doubt say that my experience was great!  I had many challenges during this time in my personal life.  However,  the staff from every department were SO helpful.  To name a few,  I give a hats off to Loretta Robinson, Anthony Palmer, Tootie Lawson, Jimmie Cummings and all the rest of the gang in Financial Aid.  Hats of to David Grier, Susan Thrasher, Brenda McCuller, Rosa Hollis, Suisan Peak, Laura Taylor...I could go on and on on.  I feel very fortunate.  Not to mention that my degree has opened many professional doors for me.  Now on the other hand...I do have a massive amount of student loans.  I will take responsibility because these are for profit schools.  It does not make it right.  But we as students should research these things before enrolling.  If I ever decide to go back to school,  I will never go to a for profit campus.  Best wishes to all the students and staff in the midst of the closures.

name: Desirée TheScorpionQueen Pugh
text: (I was in the cosmetology program recently) the curriculum is all over the place & rushed with various subjects jammed together.  you're not given the proper materials upfront to go home& practice &perfect your skills(even tho you're paying for it)They mislead you about learning materials & kits & grant money;basically there's a hidden catch to everything; they make up&change rules as they go & like another prior student said 👆you're treated like  you're in highschool . Definitely not a breeding ground for becoming a professional. but the staff is genuinely nice.(I still managed to make mostly A's &a fewB's so I'm not a venting failing student just a frustrated &disappointed student)

resp.text: We take such feedback seriously and would like the chance to speak with you about your concerns. Please call (205) 802-1200 and ask for the Campus President if you would like to discuss your experience.

text: I love the school, they just need to hire ppl to answer the phones. They never answer the phones in financial aid. So if you have a question about it, never call cause you will never get an answer! NEVER

name: aisha holifield
text: They called me and got me in to do my enrollment and within a week I was starting school and My enrollment specialist Andrew was the best.

name: Jana Herndon
text: I have not attended the school because I was only curious about a program and asked for more info. a professional school would usually send literature, maybe a phone call or few emails. These people are excessive. So far I have received 16 calls (most never left a voice mail), 2 emails (both which I have responded to, and a text! I have told them I was no longer interested at least 3 times and even said "Put me on the DO NOT CALL list". I've even written an email stating they were excessive and to please stop contacting me since I was not interested. They have yet to stop, it's getting ridiculous and it is extremely unprofessional.

resp.text: Thank you for alerting us to this, Jana, and we apologize for any inconvenience.

name: Larry Banks
text: This is crazy I called last year in 2016 and I talked with Mr. Alvin Randolf and he told me I have to send in my transcripts for my Associate's Degree in Business Management and he told me that he was going to tell me what all got transferred from my previous schools. After I sent all my transcripts to him he still wouldn't tell me what all got transferred and he refuse to switch me over to someone that could help me. He told me since I no longer have pell grant and I don't want use my loans anymore he told me I could either pay out of my pocket or use free money or get a free scholarship to pay for school. He still wouldn't explain to me what all got transferred and he wouldn't answer his phone. When I finally talked to someone else I found out that he refuse to put all my transcripts in the computer so it could show in the system who does that?! this school is a rip off and I'm glad I never got enrolled at this school. I will pray for them, I accept what that school did to me, and I bless them in Jesus name!

resp.text: We take feedback seriously and we would like the chance to discuss your concerns. Please call (205) 802-1200 and ask for President Turner if you would like to discuss your experience.

name: Tacara Bedell
text: I am a current Cosmetology student at Virginia College in Birmingham. My Enrollment Specialist Takina Cade was very friendly and helpful. She supported me throughout the enrollment process and encouraged me to follow my heart. My student finance specialist is Kasha Williams, and she has been my rock in this journey!! Between the two of them I'm on my way to earning my Cosmetology Diploma and testing for my license. The entire staff has been completely wonderful - from the security guards to the directors!

name: Daniel Morgan
text: Great school have been great to me and my wife

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, Daniel!

name: Cordell Williams
text: This school is RIDICULOUS!! I graduated from there in 2009 and it has been hell ever since! They kept giving me the run around about my diploma and on the day I was finally supposed to pick it up I was told I had to pay $950 before I could get it!! Apparently the financial aid personnel, LORETTA ROBINSON (who I'm sure is long gone because they always had a different set of people just about every quarter), had no clue what she was doing because me and several other students were told by her everything was fine before graduation and that our accounts were in the clear but when it's time to pick up our diplomas we suddenly have to pay a balance first! As far as classes, they were great and I had some great instructors, especially Mary Rockett and Morris Etheridge. But when it comes to the finance office you better pray because my experience has been that the majority of the people that were working in there when I attended were graduates of VC that couldn't get jobs in their field. After finally finding out that it was LORETTA ROBINSON's fault that I had a balance, I was told I still had to pay. Sad to say I still don't have my diploma and she completely screwed up my title IV. I wouldn't recommend anyone attend because they're going to do all that they can to get you in the door then after a while it becomes a circus! This school needs to be shut down and buried next to ITT Tech!!

resp.text: We take feedback seriously and we would like the chance to discuss your concerns. Please call (205) 802-1200 and ask for President Turner if you would like to discuss your experience.

name: RaKeya S
text: I read reviews about the school after I'd requested they send or contact me with info about their sonography program. This of course was my BIG MISTAKE! I requested the info early on a Saturday morning not expecting to hear from them until Monday, however I was surprised when I received a call at 9 a.m. (sidenote: I didn't answer or call back because the caller did not leave a message). Upon checking my email on Saturday evening I saw a message from one of their "Admissions Specialist" asking me to give her a call to set up a meeting. That seemed legitimate enough so I decided to wait until Monday morning to call. My mom, who seemed very apprehensive of my decision to check out the school, suggested that I do a little more research on them and their accreditation status. I have to admit I took them at their word or rather their posting on their site stating that they were in fact accredited when considering them. After talking to my mom I thought it couldn't hurt to look up reviews on them and OH HOW GLAD I AM THAT I DID! I've read countless reviews from students and faculty warning to stay far away from this scam of a school. The most notable are those who state how desperate VC is to sign you up and once they have they rush to start billing you for things without your knowledge. Anyways on Monday I began receiving phone calls from the same number as on Saturday, mind you this isn't the number in the email sent from the admissions specialist. I received a total of 4 phone calls from this number never with a voicemail, 2 phone calls from the admissions specialists number 1 of which had a voicemail attached but get this, the second phone call from the admission specialist's number came at 6:23 p.m. after I'd received an email at 3:11 p.m. What admissions office is still open and making calls that late?!?! Today is Tuesday and after not receiving any calls around 9 a.m. I thought they'd gotten the hint that I was no longer interested, WRONG! They decided to start hounding me with another round of calls at 12:38, 2, and finishing off at 7:08 p.m. after I'd already responded to yet another one of their "We're trying to reach you!/Let us help you!" emails in which I replied asking them to remove me from their mailing list. In my experience with the two accredited and well-respected universities I've attended I have NEVER had anyone from admissions nor any other office or program badger me with a barrage of calls or emails. I suggest you STAY FAR AWAY from this school as a whole.

name: Dakota Dix
text: i love this school all the instructors are so nice my teacher mrs.kathryn Donnellyis the best teacher anybody can ever therapeutic massage is my program and i love it and also my enrollment specialist kaye jackson is the greatest

name: Shaval Kinard
text: I graduated in 2005 from Virginia College Birmingham. I immediately went into my field after becoming certified.  Now in 2014 I have decided to further my education and attending the college again but this time I'm obtaining my degree through an online program.  The pro's are: Being able to transfer credits within the college because another college would not accept them (which I guess is a particle pro and a particle con). The Con's are: its 9 years letter and this school is still a rip off. Over priced.  They still mail out and issue at stippen checks. Be very aware of a college who is sooo behind times that they have yet to adapt to the times of electronic money handling. The admissions team has good customer service skills (but of course they would), the rest of the staff is pretty rude and inefficient.

text: Beautiful experience, even on a quick trip & rainy day!

name: Heather Lowery
text: My family and I went in April 2018. This was our first time going. You can park on the black top parking lot or go down the gravel dirt road to get to the Aboretum. We chose to park in the parking lot as the gravel road is small. When we got there everyone that worked there was very sweet and helped us find our way. There are maps of the trails available close to the “main” pavilion. The 6 and 10 year olds favorite thing was the tree top platform. We loved every minute of being out there.

name: Matthew Fister
text: The UA Arboretum is an excellent to run, walk, bring a dog, or just enjoy the flora. There are countless single file trails for those who like a more scenic or interesting trail run/walk, as well as more open, paved trails on what used to be a golf course. There is also access to a lake for swimming in the warmer months, however no fishing is allowed.

name: Steven S
text: Ridgecrest South , North tower is the best housing I have seen on campus. Covered Parking deck connected to the dorm is so convenient. 4 bedroom suite style dorm room. Each student has a single occupancy private room. A private bathroom shared by 2 students at each end. A kitchen with a full sized refrigerator sink and microwave. Common living area with a sectional couch and coffee table and TV stand. A small dinette table and chairs. Great for a freshman dorm room. Thanks UA! RTR!

resp.text: Thanks for the great review, Steven!

name: Sam Wight
text: Pretty great place to live. I lived here my freshman year and had very few complaints. The people here are all extremely nice, including the cleaning staff and RAs, and things are almost always quiet. It's a suite style dorm, so you have your own room and share a common area with 2-4 roommates. A good bit of furniture is provided, but I'd recommend bringing a card table at least for the main area, as well as a coffee table, as the provided side desk isn't very good. My room had a few different problems, including smelly air conditioning, a closet that smelled literally like cat pee, and a main area light that was extremely dim (had to buy three different lights to evenly light the room). I submitted all three of these problems as work orders, and the first two were solved really quickly (the next day). The light, however, literally took two weeks to get a replacement for, and is still unusually dim. Water pressure is also routinely a problem if you're on the fifth floor. The trash chutes are never open, which means that people leave their trash in the trash rooms and it smells whenever you walk by. Other than all this, though, this is probably the best place to live while on campus. If you have a bad roommate here, it's not as much of a problem as it is having one at new freshman or even Ridgecrest East as the two sides are separated. 10/10 would stay again.

name: Bruce Brown
text: as a parent, this is a nice dorm

resp.text: Thank you for the great review, Bruce!

name: John Glidden
text:
Honestly the best looking college dorm I've ever seen. And it's for Freshmen and on campus! This review is for the Ridgecrest Village as a whole, including South, East and West.
All three buildings are honors only dorms (that is, only students in the honors college) with 4 bedroom suites: in South (which houses both the North and South tower), each person gets their own 9' by 11' private bedroom (twin XL bed, desk, dresser, nightstand with drawer and locking cabinet, tv jack, Ethernet, phone line) and the suite shares a 12' by 14' living room (tv stand, tv jack, Ethernet, phone jack, high table with 2 tall chairs, couch, and 2 side tables) and a kitchenette (full refrigerator, microwave, and ample counter and cabinet space) amongst the 4 total roommates. Each suite also has 2 full bathrooms, which you share with one of your roommates. Before you move in, you fill out a roommate profile on the housing match site, where you can talk with several others with similar interests/living habits/study schedules/etc., and pick who you want to live with. As you get to know your roommates (generally several months) before you move in, most people will discuss who will bring what for the room (TV, wall hangings, curtains, whatever else you may want). East and West give you a little bit more room (but with a slightly smaller kitchen and showers) and an extra storage room. East and West are also a bit quieter, but South had nicer common areas, like the atrium, game room, and media room.
In all 3 buildings, there are a few 2 bedroom suites, however these are very limited and full up quickly. They are also smaller, and I personally prefer the 4 bedroom.
All 3 buildings also have several handicap accessible rooms, with larger bedrooms, bathrooms, accessible shower, and doorbell with a bright flashing light inside. There are also 2 elevators in each tower and multiple in East and West if they are needed. There may be additional accessibility features I am not aware of at this point.
In South, the laundry ($1.50 per wash and $1.25 per dryer- same across campus except international student living) and community kitchens (2 full ranges, 2 ovens, fire suppression system, 2 full refrigerators, and a seating area) are on the 2nd and 4th floors. The second floor also houses the atrium (used for several larger events put on by the college, and also used for group projects and studying), game and media rooms, so these suites fill up quickly. The 5th floor rooms all have extra tall ceilings, and several have an extra foot or 2 on the living room and bedrooms as they extend outwards from the building.
If you bring a car/truck, (which Alabama actually allows freshman to do) and you stay in any of the Ridgecrest dorms, you will be parking it in the parking garage underneath South, but it isn't more than a 90 second walk from either of the other 2 buildings.  If you prefer, there are several other lots you can park in if your vehicle doesn't fit, but the clearance is 7'8" with fairly large spots so most cars/trucks will fit. In all of the other dorms I can think of, you have to park elsewhere.  Ridgecrest is the only dorm village with built in parking for students (except handicap).
Many of then off campus housing options (which almost everybody takes with the exception of RAs and athletes) are nicer and less expensive, but as far as freshman dorms, Ridgecrest is by far my favorite.
Overall, you honestly can't go wrong with any place in the Ridgecrest village. The other suite style dorms (presidential, lakeside, riverside) are very similar, and very nice, but are for both honors and non-honors students. ROLL TIDE!

name: brenna Smith
text: Having fun.
